questions.question_text:
An organization is transitioning to an agile approach. At the project’s first sprint review, the product owner did not accept the result of the sprint and has some concerns.

What should the project manager do?

choices.D: Organize a sprint retrospective and discuss the issues and how they can be avoided in the next sprint.
choices.A: Ask the project team to address the product owner’s issues since the product owner is responsible for the scope in agile.
choices.C: Ask the product owner to accept the outcome since the team delivered what was agreed in the sprint planning.
choices.B: Create a record in the issue register and escalate the issue to the project steering committee.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Organize a sprint retrospective and discuss the issues and how they can be avoided in the next sprint
D, the sprint retrospective meeting is used for reflecting the sprint and the team’s performance and identify ways of improving

choices.A: Support the team member and provide documentation to the functional manager proving their performance.
choices.D: Discuss the issue with the functional manager to understand the reason for the complaint.
choices.C: Protect the team member and ask the project sponsor to minimize any external interruptions.
choices.B: Replace the team member immediately to maintain a good relationship with the functional manager.

questions.question_text: A project manager receives a serious complaint from a functional manager about a team member. What should the project manager do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
meet the functional manager to gather facts

Selected Answer: D
D. Discuss the issue with the functional manager to understand the reason for the complaint

choices.C: Inform the customer that subsequent packages cannot be manufactured.
choices.A: Request a change in the contract to include the shipment in the project management plan.
choices.B: Find the root cause of the issue and discuss the customer's current engagement.
choices.D: Request a delivery date extension from the customer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Find the root cause of the issue and discuss the customer's current engagement

questions.question_text:
A project involves exporting 150 packages to the customer. However, only 30 packages have been cleared by the customer for shipment. The logistics manager provided details to the customer 2 weeks ago and set up a weekly conference call to effectively communicate with them, but the customer has not been participating in the calls.

How should the project manager handle this situation?

choices.D: At the end of each and every iteration
choices.B: When the sponsor approves the increment
choices.C: When a major feature is completed

questions.question_text:
A project team is working on a product that is planned for multiple iterations. They are delivering incremental value.

When should the value be demonstrated?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. At the end of each and every iteration

Selected Answer: D
At the end of every sprint at least an increament is done , the sprint review is a collaborative event where team and stakeholders review what was done and adapt it in the backlog
